meanings.definition: Totemisms: Beliefs or practices related to totems.
meanings.sent1: Many indigenous tribes have unique totemisms that guide their way of life.
meanings.sent2: The totemisms of the ancient civilization were passed down through generations.
meanings.sent3: The totemisms of the group were so ingrained that they even influenced their daily routines.
meanings.sent4: Her totemisms were like a compass, always pointing her in the right direction.
meanings.sent5: The totemisms of the community were as diverse as the colors of a rainbow.

meanings.definition: Totemisms: The use of totems in a cultural or religious context.
meanings.sent1: The totemisms of the tribe were evident in their intricate totem poles.
meanings.sent2: In their totemisms, the people found a sense of unity and connection.
meanings.sent3: The totemisms of the ceremony added a touch of mystique to the event.
meanings.sent4: His totemisms were like a shield, protecting him from harm.
meanings.sent5: The totemisms of the festival brought a sense of reverence and awe to the participants.
